intro: Erodium daucoides subsp. daucoides, commonly known as the common erodium, is a flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is a low-growing annual herb with slender, branching stems and small, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia, often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. The species is known for its delicate appearance and is sometimes cultivated as a garden plant.
